backend.environment
Class Element

java.lang.Object
  backend.environment.Element
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Animal, Obstacle, Waypoint
public abstract class Element
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

Abstract class that models a single element in our environment. Elements are the things that exist in the environment. Each Element has the following attributes:

  1. position - the position in space
  2. velocity - the velocity vector
  3. target - the target waypoint
  4. max speed - the maximum speed that the Element can move at
  5. radius - depending on what the Element is this changes

See Also:

calculateUpdate

public void calculateUpdate(java.util.List<Element> influences,
                            HeightMap hm)
Every Element needs to be updated every simulation loop cycle. In order for this to happen two things need to happen:
  1. The update for the next cycle needs to be calculated
  2. The update needs to be applied
This function does the first step

Parameters:
influences - All Elements in the world
hm - The heightMap of the Simulation

update

public void update()
Every Element needs to be updated every simulation loop cycle. In order for this to happen two things need to happen:
  1. The update for the next cycle needs to be calculated
  2. The update needs to be applied
This function does the second step

getVelocity

public abstract Vec getVelocity()
Returns the velocity vector of the Element The velocity vector of an Element is a vector with size < 1. To get the final velocity (which is returned), this vector is scaled by the maximum speed

Returns:
The final velocity vector of the Element

setVelocity

public abstract void setVelocity(Vec v)
Sets the velocity vector of the Element. If the vector is too big then it is truncated. The vector given is scaled down by the maximum speed of the Element.

Parameters:
v - The to-scale velocity vector of the Element

clone

public abstract java.lang.Object clone()
Every Element must be forced to be able to clone itself
